title: How to Make M&M Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, whisk the baking soda, flour, and salt until well-combined.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and brown sugar using an electric mixer in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Mix on medium-high speed until well-creamed.

steps.headline: Add the pudding mixes, vanilla, and eggs.
steps.description: Cream until the mixture is well-blended and slightly liquid-like.

steps.headline: Pour the flour mixture slowly and blend on low speed.
steps.description: Slowly begin to blend slowly until the cookie dough forms and begins to become sticky.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chips and M&Ms.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill for about an hour.
Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.
Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them onto the baking sheet.
Bake the cookies for about 7-10 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.
Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit (162° Celsius).
Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.
Cream the butter, sugar, and egg using an electric mixer in a large bowl.
Melt only 1 cup of the white chocolate chips.
steps.description: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt only a cup of the white chocolate chips in the microwave, stirring every 30 seconds until completely melted.

steps.headline: Pour the melted white chocolate in the creamed mixture and stir.
Combine the cream of tarter, flour, and baking soda.
Fold in the M&Ms and the rest of the white chocolate chips.
Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them onto the baking sheet.
Bake the cookies for about 10-13 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.
Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Drizzle extra melted white chocolate chips over the cookies, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.
Cream the butter and sugar on high speed using an electric mixer in a large bowl.
Add the egg and vanilla and blend again.
Whisk the dry ingredients together in a  separate bowl.
steps.description: Whisk the flour, baking soda, cocoa powder, and salt until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the flour mixture slowly and pour in the milk.
steps.description: Blend until the cookie dough forms and is a dark color.

steps.headline: Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them flat onto the baking sheet.
Stick M&Ms on each cookie and place the cookies in the freezer to chill.
steps.description: Allow the cookies to chill for about 10-15 minutes until firm.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for about 10-11 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.
steps.description: While the cookies bake, you may want to top more M&Ms onto each cookie.

steps.headline: Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.
Cream the butter, eggs, vanilla, sugar, and cocoa powder together using an electric mixer.
Pour in the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Add the baking soda, flour, and salt and mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the M&Ms and chocolate chips.
Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them flat onto the baking sheet.
Bake the cookies for about 8-10 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.
Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Basic M&M Chocolate Chip Cookies Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, whisk the baking soda, flour, and salt until well-combined. Cream the butter and brown sugar using an electric mixer in a separate bowl. Mix on medium-high speed until well-creamed. Add the pudding mixes, vanilla, and eggs. Cream until the mixture is well-blended and slightly liquid-like. Pour the flour mixture slowly and blend on low speed. Slowly begin to blend slowly until the cookie dough forms and begins to become sticky. Fold in the chocolate chips and M&Ms.  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill for about an hour.  Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.  Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them onto the baking sheet.  Bake the cookies for about 7-10 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.  Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy! M&M White Chocolate Chip Cookies Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit (162° Celsius).  Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.  Cream the butter, sugar, and egg using an electric mixer in a large bowl.  Melt only 1 cup of the white chocolate chips. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt only a cup of the white chocolate chips in the microwave, stirring every 30 seconds until completely melted. Pour the melted white chocolate in the creamed mixture and stir.  Combine the cream of tarter, flour, and baking soda.  Fold in the M&Ms and the rest of the white chocolate chips.  Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them onto the baking sheet.  Bake the cookies for about 10-13 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.  Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Drizzle extra melted white chocolate chips over the cookies, if desired. Enjoy! M&M Dark Chocolate Chip Cookies Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.  Cream the butter and sugar on high speed using an electric mixer in a large bowl.  Add the egg and vanilla and blend again.  Whisk the dry ingredients together in a  separate bowl. Whisk the flour, baking soda, cocoa powder, and salt until well-combined. Fold in the flour mixture slowly and pour in the milk. Blend until the cookie dough forms and is a dark color. Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them flat onto the baking sheet.  Stick M&Ms on each cookie and place the cookies in the freezer to chill. Allow the cookies to chill for about 10-15 minutes until firm. Bake the cookies for about 10-11 minutes until the cookies are golden brown. While the cookies bake, you may want to top more M&Ms onto each cookie. Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk, if desired. Enjoy! M&M Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Line parchment paper on a baking sheet.  Cream the butter, eggs, vanilla, sugar, and cocoa powder together using an electric mixer.  Pour in the dry ingredients. Add the baking soda, flour, and salt and mix until well-combined. Fold in the M&Ms and chocolate chips.  Scoop the cookie dough into balls and lay them flat onto the baking sheet.  Bake the cookies for about 8-10 minutes until the cookies are golden brown.  Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Lay a few cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk, if desired. Enjoy!
